intro: Carex esbirajbhandarii, commonly known as the Esbirajbhandari sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the eastern Himalayas, specifically found in regions of India and Nepal. This perennial plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It features grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
